html: Enormous wealth, kept in reserve to support the restoration of Jehovah’s people, comes forth at the time Jehovah appoints his end-time servant. As with Jehovah’s grasping him by the hand (v 1), calling him by name signifies royal investiture—as when an emperor legally adopts a vassal or elevates him to higher status (cf. Isaiah 8:11; 40:26; 42:6). That appointment is “for the sake of” Jacob/Israel in order that Jehovah’s people may again become his collective “servant” or vassal. Jehovah’s naming his servant “when yet you knew me not” signifies his foreordination to his earthly mission (Isaiah 49:1).
